sections.title: Turns
rules: Players act simultaneously, followed by monsters and NPCs
The GM will inform players if their character is in danger (such as a monster targeting you with its next potential attack)
GM rolls for the monsters' action(s)

actions.name: Attack
actions.description: Roll 1d10 against @AttackStat. If the roll is lower, deal 1 @PhysicalDamage (2 for a natural 1, aka a crit). If your @Insight is too low to perceive a monster as it is, they take -1 damage from your attacks.

actions.name: Dodge
actions.description: Roll 1d10 against @Agility. If the roll is lower, immune to dodgeable attacks until next turn and regain 1 @HitPoints. If you roll a 10 and the monster successfully attacks you on this turn, the GM checks the Crit Fail column on the Monster Stats.

actions.name: Brace
actions.description: Roll 1d10 against @Body. If the roll is lower and you have a weapon, armor, or shield, you are immune to braceable attacks until next turn and regain 1 @HitPoints. If you roll a 10 and the monster successfully attacks you on this turn, the GM checks the Crit Fail column on the Monster Stats.

actions.name: Gather a Spell
actions.description: Roll 1d10 against @Focus. If the roll is lower, draw 1 @Spell from your @Spell deck. If you roll a 10 you lose 1 @HitPoints, and discard all held @Spell cards.

actions.name: Flee
actions.description: Roll 1d10 against @Agility. If the roll is lower, you can successfully exit the combat and cannot be in danger for the next round. If the roll fails, you remain in combat.

actions.name: Negotiate
actions.description: Roll 1d10 against @Focus. If the roll is lower, combat will end momentarily to present the opportunity to negotiate with a monster that can understand you. If combat resumes after negotiations fail, the monster(s) go first.

sections.title: Weapons
sections.description: Weapons do not have extensive effects on combat. Two-weapons, polearms, and ranged weapons, or special weapons let you roll with @Advantage when attacking.

sections.title: Advantage and Disadvantage
rules: When you have @Advantage, roll 2d10 and choose the lower result for your roll
When you have @Disadvantage, roll 2d10 and choose the higher result for your roll
@Advantage and @Disadvantage cancel each other out - if you have both, roll normally with 1d10

examples: Using specialized weapons (two-weapons, polearms, ranged weapons)
Attacking from a position of superiority (flanking, high ground)
Using equipment or spells that grant benefits
Fighting in poor conditions (darkness, difficult terrain)

types.name: Physical Damage
types.description: Standard @Damage from conventional weapons such as swords, guns, clubs, and other mundane armaments. Most creatures can be harmed by @PhysicalDamage, though some may have resistance or immunity to certain types of physical attacks.

types.name: Spiritual Damage
types.description: @Damage that affects the soul or essence of a creature. Particularly effective against undead, demons, and other supernatural entities. Some creatures may be vulnerable to @SpiritualDamage while being resistant to @PhysicalDamage attacks.

types.name: Hybrid Damage
types.description: @Damage that combines both @PhysicalDamage and @SpiritualDamage elements, making it effective against a wider range of creatures. These weapons and attacks can harm both corporeal and incorporeal beings.

equipment.name: Shield
equipment.effect: Roll an additional d10 when bracing, choose the lower.

equipment.name: Armor
equipment.effect: Roll an additional d10 when bracing, choose the lower.

conditions.name: Frightened
conditions.description: A creature that is @Frightened cannot @Attack on their turn or willingly move towards the source of their fear if there's another route of escape.

conditions.name: Unconscious
conditions.description: A creature cannot defend against an @Attack, or make @Attack actions, or move. @Attack actions against an @Unconscious creature automatically succeed. Creatures that survive an @Attack while @Unconscious may awaken at the start of their next turn.

conditions.name: Diseased
conditions.description: When diseased, characters make all tests with @Disadvantage. This represents illness, poison, or other debilitating conditions that weaken the character's performance.
